snippet: Ahead of a United Nations report, the ministry argues that Israel’s troops adhered to international law and blames Palestinian militants for the bulk of the civilian casualties in last summer’s war.
abstract: Israel's Foreign Ministry issues paper blaming Palestinian militants for most casualties incurred during 2014 war with Israel and arguing that Israeli soldiers adhered to international law in conflict; paper comes as preemptive strike against United Nations report on war in Gaza.

byline.contributor: Majd al Waheidi contributed reporting from Gaza.

lead_paragraph: Ahead of a United Nations report, the ministry argues that Israel’s troops adhered to international law and blames Palestinian militants for the bulk of the civilian casualties in last summer’s war.

headline.main: Israel’s Foreign Ministry Issues Report Defending Conduct in Gaza War
headline.print_headline: In Bid to Pre-empt U.N. Report, Israel Issues Study Defending Conduct in Gaza War
